topics.title: FINALSHOW
topics.description: The Changing Earth project, a school assignment, is an immersive platform aiming to educate about human-induced climate change. It visually represents the profound impact of climate change through engaging visuals and interactive features, urging visitors to understand the urgency of addressing climate-related issues.

roles.title: Web Developer
roles.responsibilities: I was responsible for designing and developing the homepage of the web application, as well as the timetable page.

roles.title: Designer
roles.responsibilities: My design contributions played a vital role in creating an aesthetically pleasing and cohesive visual identity for the project.

roles.title: Scrum master
roles.responsibilities: As the Scrum Master, I was tasked with orchestrating the Agile development process within our team.

roles.title: Team
roles.responsibilities: This project was a collaborative effort among four team members. Teamwork and effective communication were at the core of our success.

topics.objective1: To seamlessly integrate a recorded physical award show with an interactive digital platform.
topics.objective2: To provide attendees and participants with a visually engaging and user-friendly interface to explore event activities.

topics.title: CHANGING EARTH
topics.descriptionpreview: The Changing Earth project, a school assignment, is an immersive platform aiming to educate about human-induced climate change. It visually represents the profound impact of climate change through engaging visuals and interactive features, urging visitors to understand the urgency of addressing climate-related issues.
topics.description: The Changing Earth project, created as a school assignment, serves as an immersive platform to educate and raise awareness about the human causes of climate change. Its primary objective is to provide a visual representation of the profound impact climate change has on society and the environment. Through compelling visuals and interactive features, this project seeks to engage and inform visitors about the urgency of addressing climate-related issues.

roles.title: Web Developer
roles.responsibilities: Leveraging the power of modern web technologies, I implemented the project using React and a range of related libraries and frameworks.

roles.title: Designer
roles.responsibilities: I conceptualized the project's design and interactive elements, aiming to create a visually engaging and educational experience.

topics.objective1: To inform visitors about the human causes of climate change and the consequences for society and the planet.
topics.objective2: Create an immersive and interactive experience that encourages exploration and learning.

topics.title: Dynamic Transitions
topics.description: Embark on a digital journey with my page-transition app. The homepage unveils a captivating news article, gracefully fading in and out. Text elegantly types itself onscreen, revealing its message like a typewriter in action. Watch as the page fills with newspaper blocks, forming a cohesive narrative puzzle. Images appear, distorting like dreams, and scrolling unfolds new pages seamlessly. Welcome to a world of fluid digital storytelling.

topics.title: Three.js Interaction
topics.description: Create a one-page app using Three.js, featuring the functionality to upload and save 3D objects, display a list of available objects with rotate and zoom controls for a preview mode. Extend the interactivity by incorporating elements such as toggling a lamp on or off within a static 3D room.

topics.title: Browser game
topics.description: Dive into the Interactive Browser Game a two-week project built with Three.js, three rapier, drei, fiber, and r3f-perf. Experience a captivating 3D world, control your character with keyboard or mouse inputs, and interact with various objects for a visually impressive and enjoyable gaming experience.

roles.title: Web Developer
roles.responsibilities: Leveraging the power of modern web technologies, I implemented the project using React and a range of related libraries and frameworks.

roles.title: Designer
roles.responsibilities: I conceptualized the project's design and interactive elements, aiming to create a visually engaging and educational experience.

topics.objective1: Create an enthralling browser game showcasing the synergy of React and Three.js, offering players a unique and visually rich gaming experience.
topics.objective2: Develop an immersive world with interactive elements, encouraging users to explore and engage in the learning process.

topics.title: Login Systeem
topics.description: Create a prototype login system within a two-week timeframe, utilizing technology of node.js. Implement a user and authentication system, and establish a role-based access control system allowing users to have specific permissions based on their roles.

roles.title: Frontend Developer
roles.responsibilities: Leveraging the power of modern web technologies, I implemented the project's frontend using React.

roles.title: Backend Developer
roles.responsibilities: In the backend, I utilized Node.js and MongoDB to implement the project's server-side logic and database functionality.

topics.objective1: To develop a robust and secure login system with user authentication and authorization capabilities.
topics.objective2: Create a seamless and user-friendly experience with role-based access control for specific permissions.
